channel.title: Stuff and Things
channel.description: Just a place where I can write things down ...

item.title: Summer APL
item.description:
Brewed this about 6 weeks ago, but never recorded it, due to the apparent loss (hopefully temporary?) of my brewing notebooks. It was the first beer brewed at my new place in SF (despite living here for almost 6 months). Grain bill is modeled after the maibock I made with Carl a while back.

Recipe is as follows ...

Grain:

  • 8 lbs. German Pilsner Malt
  • 4 lbs. German Munich Malt
  • 1/4 lb. Acid Malt
  • 1/4 lb. Melanoiden Malt

Hops:

  • 1 oz. Summer (5% AA) FWH
  • 1 oz. Hersebrucker (4% AA) FWH
  • 1 oz. Summer (5% AA) Flameout
  • 1 oz. Hersebrucker (4% AA) Flameout

Wort:

OG: 1.060.

Yeast:

2 packs W-34/70

Ferment:

FG: 1.014. Added 0.4 oz. sugar for carbonation, and let sit at room temperature for re-fermentation + diacetyl rest for 3 days, then transferred to freezer to lager at ~3°C.

Taste:

Malt and yeast character are nice. Summer hops are very fruity ... too assertive for a maibock style lager, but without the sort of edge appropriate for and APA/XPA. Could do better paired with some citrussy/dank American hops, or in a maltier (possibly English) style.

item.title: Brown Saison
item.description:
Brewed this about a month ago, but never recorded it, due to the apparent loss (hopefully temporary?) of my brewing notebooks. Modeled after a black saison that was particularly well received, though I apparently eased up on the roast/dark malts.

Wort:

OG: 1.056.

Yeast:

1 pack Belle Saison

Ferment:

Started around 66°F, let sit for 48 hours, then ramped up to 72°F. FG: 1.004. Added 0.4 oz. sugar for carbonation, and let sit at room temperature for re-fermentation, then transferred to keg fridge.

Taste:

Initial review is hot with tons of phenol. Neither malt nor hops are assertive enough. Thin. Hopefully this will evolve a bit ...

item.title: Boxing Day XPA
item.description:
Brewed an XPA today with pils/munich base hopped with mosaic, amarillo, and centennial.

Got started around 10:00 AM, but was in no particular rush. Cleaned up around 4:30 PM. Mash went well, despite having just enough foil for the screen. Hit target gravity, but a little short on wort (poured the sludge in to hit 5 gallons). Was able to get down to 70° with the sump pump and a single bag of ice.

Was going to do an even split of mosaic and amarillo, but found a bag of centennial that was asking to be used.

Recipe is as follows ...

Grain:

  • 10 lbs. German Pilsner Malt
  • 4 lbs. German Munich Malt
  • 1 lb. White Wheat Malt
  • 1/4 lb. Acid Malt
  • 1/4 lb. Melanoiden Malt

Mash:

Mashed in at 148° for what turned out to be ~75 minutes.

Hops:

  • 1 oz. Mosaic (12.5% AA) FWH
  • 0.5 oz. Amarillo (8.4% AA) FWH
  • 0.5 oz. Centenial (11.8% AA) FWH
  • 1 oz. Mosaic (12.5% AA) Flameout
  • 0.7 oz. Amarillo (8.4% AA) Flameout
  • 0.3 oz. Centenial (11.8% AA) Flameout
  • 1 oz. Mosaic (12.5% AA) Dry Hop
  • 0.6 oz. Amarillo (8.4% AA) Dry Hop
  • 0.4 oz. Centenial (11.8% AA) Dry Hop

Boil:

A little over 90 minutes. Used two pots to get more burner.

Wort:

OG: 1.072. Barely 5 gallons (with sludge).

Yeast:

1 pack US-05
